characterList.description: An African-American male in late 20s or 30s, with a beard, wearing a black hoodie, voice only.
characterList.name: Narrator

content_metadata.description: A video analyzing a phone conversation about a job opportunity at Fraley and Schilling, Inc., focusing on truck driving positions.

qAndA.question: What is the name of the company offering the job opportunity?

qAndA.answer: The company offers both Van and Flatbed driving jobs.
qAndA.question: What type of truck driving jobs are offered?

qAndA.answer: A minimum of 6 months of tractor-trailer experience is required for flatbed driving.
qAndA.question: How much experience is required for the flatbed driving position?

qAndA.answer: The recruiter mentions competitive pay, consistent home time, and a positive work environment.
qAndA.question: How does the company retain its drivers?

qAndA.answer: The spinning car wheel, although not directly tied to the conversation, acts as a visual reminder of the trucking industry, subtly reinforcing the theme of the video.
qAndA.question: How does the animated spinning car wheel contribute to the overall mood of the video?

activities.description: Narrator and Recruiter discuss job opportunity

characterInteraction.description: Engage in a friendly, informal conversation.

scenes.contextualRelevance: Discussion relevant to potential truck drivers and individuals interested in job opportunities at Fraley and Schilling, Inc.

keyMoments.changeDescription: Narrator's mood changes from confused to curious as he learns about the company.

narrativeProgression.description: Narrator receives a call about a job opportunity and inquires about the company.
Narrator and Recruiter discuss the job opportunity, salary, and details.

props.name: Thumbs up icon and "LEAVE A LIKE" text
Comment icon and "LEAVE A COMMENT" text

scenes.thematicElements: Job hunting, truck driving, company benefits, employee retention
scenes.title: Phone Conversation

climax.description: Unclear climax as the video ends without Narrator's decision.

storylines.description: Job Opportunity Discussion between Narrator and Recruiter about truck driving positions at Fraley and Schilling, Inc.

youtube_description:
The Lockoutmen Podcast Show explores The Trucking Companies by calling and talking with recruiters to see what they have to offer. A recruiter job is to get you in the seat by any means necessary
 
In this Episode Lockoutmen talks with Fraley & Schilling 
Getting Better Since 1955.
Since 1955, Fraley & Schilling has consistently focused on continuous improvement to not only provide a great service, but to give the best of the best drivers the opportunity to join a company on the “cutting edge”. With that in mind, we exclusively recruit and employ a driver support staff who are not only trained professionals, but also have a genuine appreciation for the life and challenges that are put in front of drivers everyday
See more about Fraley & Schilling
 here: 
https://drivefs.com/ 
PHONE
(800) 428-6640
(765) 932-5594
https://intelliapp.driverapponline.com/c/fraleyandschilling?r=drivefs&uri_b=ia_fraleyandschilling_1911726913


Thanks To Artur Express Trucking For Sponsoring This Channel for more info and to appy here:
https://intelliapp.driverapponline.com/c/arturexp?r=lockoutmen

New CHANNEL: THE BULLISH CHANNEL https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCS4ShB8gFvrxM-Vs7kkKEng

Lockoutmen new Tic Toc: https://www.tiktok.com/@lockoutmenpodcast?lang=en

Check out more dope interviews like this one on:
🎙 Look up "Lockoutmen Podcast" on these Podcast Platforms:
Amazon Music / Spotify / Apple Podcasts / Google Podcast / iHeartRadio / Podcast Addict / Overcast / Breaker / CastBox / PocketCast / Radio Public / Stitcher

Here's Lockoutmen Truckers Path Spotlight: 
https://truckerpath.com/blog/trucker-spotlight-lashaune/

Federal law permits recording telephone calls and in-person conversations with the consent of at least one of the parties. 
See 18 U.S.C. 2511(2)(d).
This is called a “one-party consent” law. 
Under a one-party consent law, you can record a phone call or conversation so long as YOU are a party to the conversation.
